title: RealPlayer
overview: RealPlayer is released, becoming one of the first widely used Internet media players, enabling audio and video streaming in the dial-up era.

title: Napster
overview: Napster popularizes peer-to-peer file sharing of MP3 music, disrupting the music industry and paving the way for digital distribution models.

title: Apple iTunes
overview: Apple launches iTunes, an online music store integrated with iPods, legitimizing digital music sales and reshaping the recording industry.

title: YouTube
overview: YouTube is founded, enabling easy video uploads and streaming worldwide. It quickly becomes the largest video platform and a cultural phenomenon.

title: Spotify Founded
overview: Spotify is founded in Sweden, launching its streaming music service two years later, pioneering legal, ad-supported and subscription streaming models.

title: Netflix Streaming
overview: Netflix expands from DVD rentals to streaming movies and TV online, redefining home entertainment and on-demand media consumption.

title: Twitch (as Justin.tv Gaming)
overview: Justin.tv spins off Twitch, focusing on live video game streaming, which grows into the worldâ€™s leading live streaming platform for gaming and esports.

title: Netflix Originals
overview: Netflix releases 'House of Cards' and 'Orange is the New Black', marking its transformation from distributor to content producer and redefining media models.

title: Disney+ Launch
overview: Disney+ launches with an extensive library of movies and shows, joining the competitive streaming wars against Netflix, Amazon, and Hulu.

title: Streaming Boom During COVID-19
overview: Global streaming usage surges during the COVID-19 pandemic, with services like Zoom, Netflix, and YouTube becoming essential for entertainment and communication.
